<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/25/s-show-time-apple?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It’s Show Time for Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The quick version: </strong>Apple is expected to <a href="https://9to5mac.com/2019/03/23/apple-march-event-preview/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch</a> its original content and streaming video services today.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The long(er) version</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sorry to break it to you, but this isn’t <em>exactly </em>the Apple vs. Netflix pay-per-view you ordered. This is Apple vs. every other third party selling video subscription services.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix has carved a name for itself creating bingeworthy original content (that’ll cost $15 billion <a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/netflix-content-spending-2019-15-billion-1203112090/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this year</a>). But for all the star power <a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/apple-video-tv-news-subscription-service-1203169583/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston</a> bring to Cupertino, Apple’s original content is more like the cherry on top of the sundae.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The sundae—at least for now:</strong> using Reese & Co. to get users on the platform, then selling those users subscriptions to premium services like HBO, Showtime, and more, all while taking a cut.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It could work. Apple’s already got more than 1 billion devices across the globe (compared to Netflix’s 139 million subscribers worldwide). In the biz they call that owning the </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/22/multimedia/netflix-apple-tv-streaming.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pipes</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">You’re looking at the Amazon model</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since its 2015 launch, Amazon Prime Channels has capitalized on existing customer relationships. It’s a lot easier to click “purchase now” on a 12-month HBO deal when Amazon already has your billing info on file.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">One crazy stat: </strong></span><span>The Diffusion Group estimated Amazon was </span><span><a href="https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/amazon-dominates-direct-to-consumer-tv-network-subscriptions-300649542.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responsible</a></span><span> a year ago for about 55% of all standalone video subscriptions.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what makes Apple’s different?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.recode.net/2019/3/21/18275747/apple-tv-launch-plans-event-hbo-showtime-starz-netflix-news-magazine-goldman-amazon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">According to Recode</a>, Apple is expected to create a new storefront on the upcoming service that will streamline buying TV subscription apps. Instead of scrolling through streaming apps in a crowded App Store, all your shows will be in one convenient spot.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, Apple is widely expected to offer its own bundles of premium services like Showtime, HBO, and Starz to its 1.4 billion users at lower price points than you’d pay for each individually.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who’s notably sitting out the bundle? You might’ve figured it out by now...Netflix.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/25/comes-apple-event-speculate-responsibly?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When It Comes to the Apple Event, Speculate Responsibly
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple's Hollywood play just goes to show, you can make one of the most successful devices in the history of humankind...but if you don’t have a <em>Queer Eye </em>reboot, you’re losing ground.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What we think we know</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Original video content:</strong></span><span> Five series have wrapped up filming, and about six others are finishing production, </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/17/business/media/apple-content-hollywood.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports the NYT</a></span><span>. Top Hollywood talent includes Octavia Spencer, Steven Spielberg, and the </span><span><em>Always Sunny</em></span><span> guys.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">News subscriptions:</strong></span><span> Apple will likely reveal a service that bundles news and magazines together for a flat monthly fee. The WSJ and Vox are </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-21/apple-is-said-to-sign-up-vox-site-for-news-subscription-service?srnd=technology-vp" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly on board</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bundles: </strong></span><span>See above.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What we know we don’t know</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pricing and timing</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Will the content be exclusive to Apple devices?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Will we get more info about a credit card with Goldman Sachs?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Any news on a video games subscription? </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What we know we know</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This event, which puts the exclamation mark on Apple’s shift to services, is one for the history e-book subscriptions.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/25/italy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Do You, Italy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, Italy shrugged off peer pressure and became the first country in the G7—a group of seven major world economies—to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/23/world/europe/italy-china-xi-silk-road.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">join</a> China’s “One Belt One Road” project.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One Belt One Road 101: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China wants to be the world’s construction company. Through building ports, highways, railroads, and pipelines across the globe, it hopes to spread its economic and political influence.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s now got </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-19/italy-s-embrace-of-china-s-belt-and-road-is-a-snub-to-washington?utm_content=business&cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">124 countries on board</a></span><span> with the project. But Italy, as a gateway to Europe, might be the most strategic yet.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Italy's goal: </strong>to export more goods to the Chinese market. “There is a lot of ‘Made in China’ coming to Italy and too little ‘Made in Italy’ that goes to China,” Italy’s economic development minister <a href="https://apnews.com/dae5c72c5cf94e6cb3dce96f9ba9c62f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. He must not know about all the Pizza Huts in Shanghai...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The U.S. and other European countries, alarmed at the growing power of China, can <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-future-d2d1e68b-8aae-4a1d-ba8b-d35cfdde755a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hardly believe</a> Italy is getting cozy with Beijing.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/25/legal-weed-drama?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Legal Weed Drama
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ec/Lower_Trenton_Bridge_20091103-jag9889.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We spent the weekend suffering through Orange Vanilla Coke commercials. New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy spent the weekend enlisting support for the legalization of marijuana in his state.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">N.J. lawmakers are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-24/new-jersey-braces-for-tight-legalization-vote-cannabis-weekly?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected to vote</a> today on whether it’ll become the 11th state to legalize recreational weed, but the increasingly complicated measure could hit a wall.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As of Saturday night, NJ's Democratic-controlled state Senate was short a handful of </span><span><a href="https://www.nj.com/marijuana/2019/03/heres-where-the-scramble-for-legal-weed-in-nj-stands-2-days-before-the-big-vote.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">votes</a></span><span> needed to pass the bill.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NJ </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/19/nyregion/nj-marijuana-legalization.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supporters</a></span><span> have promised legalization would bring the $50 billion national legal weed industry to NYC’s doorstep. Detractors aren’t sold on the risks.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Plus, </strong>on Tuesday, the U.S. House Financial Services Committee is scheduled to vote on the SAFE Act—which would permit commercial banks to offer services to weed companies compliant with state law.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Yea or nay on this week’s legislation, cannabis compounds are everywhere. Just last week, CVS <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-20/cvs-joins-cannabis-derived-wellness-trend-selling-cbd-products?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struck a deal</a> with Curaleaf Holdings to get cannabis-infused products on shelves at 800+ CVS stores.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Q1 saved the best week for last.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>GDP; jobless claims; earnings (Accenture); March Madness continues; opening day for the MLB</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Lyft’s IPO; consumer sentiment; PCE data; earnings (CarMax, BlackBerry)</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/25/take-talents-brew?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Take Your Talents to the Brew
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553457959.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every day we write about exciting companies doing awesome things. Well, not to get too meta on you, but one of those companies is Morning Brew. We are growing like a weed and we’re hiring creative and motivated people to spread to every corner of the business news garden.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So whether you thought that metaphor was clever or an abomination, you should check out the three (3) incredible writing opportunities we have available:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Daily Newsletter Writer </strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Newsletter Writer</strong></span><span><strong style="color:#000">—</strong></span><span><strong style="color:#000">Business of Marketing/Advertising</strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Newsletter Writer</strong></span><span><strong style="color:#000">—</strong></span><span><strong style="color:#000">Business of Retail </strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s not all. We’re also looking to hire a...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Graphic Designer</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Growth Marketer</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Advertising Operations Coordinator</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Tight end</strong></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All positions are full-time and based in NYC. Join our growing team and apply <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ Happy with your current job but know the person who’d be perfect for the Brew? Refer them and get $1,000 from us if they join the team. </p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe quick version: \u003c/strong\u003eApple is expected to \u003ca href=\"https://9to5mac.com/2019/03/23/apple-march-event-preview/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunch\u003c/a\u003e its original content and streaming video services today.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe long(er) version\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSorry to break it to you, but this isn’t \u003cem\u003eexactly \u003c/em\u003ethe Apple vs. Netflix pay-per-view you ordered. This is Apple vs. every other third party selling video subscription services.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix has carved a name for itself creating bingeworthy original content (that’ll cost $15 billion \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/netflix-content-spending-2019-15-billion-1203112090/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethis year\u003c/a\u003e). But for all the star power \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/apple-video-tv-news-subscription-service-1203169583/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston\u003c/a\u003e bring to Cupertino, Apple’s original content is more like the cherry on top of the sundae.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe sundae—at least for now:\u003c/strong\u003e using Reese \u0026 Co. to get users on the platform, then selling those users subscriptions to premium services like HBO, Showtime, and more, all while taking a cut.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt could work. Apple’s already got more than 1 billion devices across the globe (compared to Netflix’s 139 million subscribers worldwide). In the biz they call that owning the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/22/multimedia/netflix-apple-tv-streaming.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epipes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eYou’re looking at the Amazon model\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince its 2015 launch, Amazon Prime Channels has capitalized on existing customer relationships. It’s a lot easier to click “purchase now” on a 12-month HBO deal when Amazon already has your billing info on file.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne crazy stat: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Diffusion Group estimated Amazon was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/amazon-dominates-direct-to-consumer-tv-network-subscriptions-300649542.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresponsible\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a year ago for about 55% of all standalone video subscriptions.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what makes Apple’s different?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.recode.net/2019/3/21/18275747/apple-tv-launch-plans-event-hbo-showtime-starz-netflix-news-magazine-goldman-amazon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAccording to Recode\u003c/a\u003e, Apple is expected to create a new storefront on the upcoming service that will streamline buying TV subscription apps. Instead of scrolling through streaming apps in a crowded App Store, all your shows will be in one convenient spot.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, Apple is widely expected to offer its own bundles of premium services like Showtime, HBO, and Starz to its 1.4 billion users at lower price points than you’d pay for each individually.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWho’s notably sitting out the bundle?
